unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop, analytically describe, and implement both single and multiparameter probability models in the Bayesian framework
Explain and communicate to a non-expert audience the fundamentals of the Bayesian approach to Statistics
Solve real world problems using Bayesian Methods and state-of-art software tools
Design hierarchical models exploiting Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulation methods, and apply them to common statistical models including Generalised Linear Models
Construct conjugate families of prior distributions for common sampling distributions
Formulate and carry out Bayesian inference procedures such as point and interval estimation and hypothesis testing, for common sampling distributions

enrolment_rules.description: ((Admission to MAppStat or GradCertAppStat or GradDipAppStat or MDataSc or MActPrac) and (STAT806 or STAT810 or STAT6110 or STAT8310)) or (Admission to BMathScMAppStat and permission by special approval)

assessments.description: The report will focus mainly on the material covered in Lecture Weeks 7-10.

Students are required to produce a media presentation demonstrating a unit topic of their choice. This demonstration needs to be a brief and accessible to other students that haven't studied the specific topic but have similar Mathematics/Statistics background.
The report will focus mainly on the material covered in Lecture Weeks 4-6.
The report will focus mainly on the material covered in Lecture Weeks 1-3.

data.description: This unit introduces main concepts and methods of Bayesian analysis with a clear comparison with frequentist statistical methods. Both single-parameter and multi-parameter models are derived. Bayesian computation techniques and Bayesian regression models, which include linear, GLM and hierarchical models, are studied in the unit. This unit highlights and exploits computational aspects of Bayesian data analysis including Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods (Gibbs sampling, Hastings-Metropolis) using the latest computational tools.
data.title: Bayesian Data Analysis

description: This unit introduces main concepts and methods of Bayesian analysis with a clear comparison with frequentist statistical methods. Both single-parameter and multi-parameter models are derived. Bayesian computation techniques and Bayesian regression models, which include linear, GLM and hierarchical models, are studied in the unit. This unit highlights and exploits computational aspects of Bayesian data analysis including Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods (Gibbs sampling, Hastings-Metropolis) using the latest computational tools.
title: Bayesian Data Analysis
